subject: Re: [junit] Package Structure
msgSnippet: On Wed, 11 Aug 2004  and  both provided the same valuable info (below). For anyone else interested, though, there was
messageBody:
On Wed, 11 Aug 2004 <jbrains@...> and <mike@...> both
provided the same valuable info (below). For anyone else interested,
though, there was one step missing.
Step 5 needs to be subdivided to:

5a. Now select each source folder.
5b. Expand it to show "Included", "Excluded" and "Output folder".
5c. Select "Output folder" and *then* press Edit...

Perhaps this was different in pre-3.0 versions of Eclipse, but that is the
way it works now.

Thanks to both for pointing me in the right direction.
~~Michael Sorens


> michael sorens wrote:
>> Just the information I needed on source folders in Eclipse! However, I'm
>> having trouble figuring out in Eclipse how to specify separate output
>> folders for each source folder. The help file even has just such a help
>> topic, but the instructions are not quite coherent (to me, anyway).
>> Could
>> someone elucidate?
>
> 1 Right-click your project, choose Properties.
> 2 Select Java Build Path.
> 3 Select the Source tab.
> 4 Check the box "Allow output folders for source folders".
> 5 Now select each source folder, press Edit...
> 6 Set the output folder for that source folder.
> 7 Repeat for all source folders.
>
> Good luck.
